title: Problems with office365 and POP3
content:
Hi Guys

I am running Thunderbird 102.8 (32 bit version) on an up to date Windows 10 on a Dell Inspiron 15 3000 laptop.

A couple of weeks ago the ability to download emails or to send emails stopped working. When I send I get asked to re-enter the password and when i want to receive it just hangs saying its trying to sign-in.

I can access my office365 based email via their web interface, and also from my old android phone but not using Thunderbird.

I have looked at the previously reported version of this problem, the last time seems to be in July 2022, so I think it has come back.

The underlaying email account is provided by BT Business. They have said that as its works from the web browser and also my phone the problem must be with Thunderbird.

Any help would be most welcome.

Thanks

Ian

title: Thunderbird suddenly started showing plain-text messages in HUGE fixed-width font
content:
I prefer plain-text messages, and use them as the default. I've had no problems with having ordinary-sized characters showing in messages I send or those I receive . . . until very recently. Suddenly, all my plain-text messages (old as well as new, and across at least two active accounts within the same copy of Thunderbird) show up in HUGE fonts -- about 36-point, I'd guess.

I don't know why -- whether somebody sent me a message which caused this (from its own content or through a bug) or it's the fault of some other program. I'm running under Windows 11 and am at version 102.7.2 -- and will gladly update to 102.8 if that will help, but don't want to jump the gun.

I hope there is a simple answer to this.

title: Attachents are not always visible from the message display pane in both incoming and sent emails
content: Ever since the message display pane has changed, I have had intermittent issues with knowing if there are attachments to an email, both incoming and ensuring that an outgoing email included attachments. In the classic view, these show up in a pane at the bottom, while in the current "new" display pane, if a message is attached, one has to scroll all the way to the bottom, and sometimes even then it is not present until after I have opened the message in classic view. Likewise, the paper clip icon sometimes does not show an attachment until after I have opened the email in classic view or I have scrolled to the bottom in the "new" view and observed there is an attachment. Is there any way to restore the classic view as my default? I am currently using TB 102.7.2.
creator: jfg223

title: Thunderbird resource consumption on linux is out of control
content: I'm wondering if any effort is being put towards optimization of Thunderbird for linux. One of my workstations is dead silent, even with 20 terminals, several firefox windows with dozens of tabs, youtube, and Slack running. If I launch Thunderbird, however, I can hear the CPU fan spinning up as the machine starts to overheat. Given that this is a relatively new 11th gen Intel i5 system with 32GB of memory, this just seems wrong to me. My MUA shouldn't consume more resources than every other process on the system combined!

title: Mail does not arrive at destination - also impossible to mail to myself
content:
I noticed yesterday that when I tried to send a mail to myself that it did not arrive in the Inbox of either Thunderbird or that of the Inbox of the webmail of my ISP which is Proximus in Belgium. The mail is correctly copied to the sent folder where it can be viewed without a problem. There are no visible error messages displayed.

I use two identities and it is my identity, which is the default one, that has the problems. My wife’s identity-address can still mail to itself without problems. I have contacted a few regular recipients and they mention that the last mail from my address was around 10 days ago. Mails destined for them have been sent since then but have not reached their destination …

I have tried the Troubleshoot mode and clearing the cache without success in sending a mail to the same default identity-sending address.

I use Bitdefender Total security and the firewall allows access to thunderbird.exe regularly. Details of the Thunderbird release, the SMTP server and add-ons are shown in the screen prints attached.

Other suggestions ?

Thanks in advance Peter
creator: peter.billington

title: Ever since I set up Thunderbird on a new device, the inbox will not retain emails older than 30 days.
content:
I posted about this issue months ago. I got a reply but it didn't fully solve my problem.

1. I had this email account set up on a device, working perfectly fine. It was an using an IMAP protocol. No issues.

2. I needed to add this account to a new device, (at my home, away from work).

3. When I signed into the account, it setup the email using POP3 instead of IMAP.

Ever since this has been setup, the email at the workplace (using IMAP) was missing thousands of emails from the inbox. Only the inbox, no other folders were affected. The device at the home (POP3) retains all those previous emails in the inbox but is missing many emails from the SENT folder. Nothing was deleted. There is nothing in junk. This change with the POP3 protocol is the only factor that could explain why this has screwed up our past year.

When I access the webmail, none of those emails from the inbox are there.

I attempted to copy the profile from the POP3 computer at home and pasted it into a new thunderbird configuration at the workplace. No accounts were there when I pasted the profile. However, this has only acted as a storage unit for the emails and is not a functioning account.

Does anyone have advice on how to rectify this without losing the old emails?
creator: alexandra19

title: Authentification failure while connecting to server imap.gmail.com - already tried a lot of solutions
content:
I've struggled with this for 6 weeks. Got it to work 'once' (to load old messages), but never again since. I think that time I turned off my Norton. Here is the issue.

Old PC craashed, so no clean transition to new one (though I do have my old files from the HD) Loaded Thunderbird on new one. Changed all the settings her what I saw. Kept getting the 'Authentication..' error above. Tried to load at least 5 times. Then once I did something with my Norton (I think), and old messages loaded into Thunderbird. But then it stopped working and reverted to the message.

I mapped out what I thought were some solutions below, and then have tried them 1) Ensure Cookies are accepted 2) OAuth2 in setup 3) Make sure IMAP is selected 4) Turn off Antivirus (I think I am doing something wrong here, Norton doesn't make this easy). I have Windows 11, so may be something in there as well 5) Turn off MailShield (don't think I have this as I cannot find it) 6) Remove old Passwords (cannot figure out where these are, and doesn't work when I enter in my new Gmail password that works for my webmail) 7) Tried to change back to Accept Normal Password and that did not work either.

Appreciate any thoughts or ideas, or somewhere comprehensive that would walk me through 'everything' I need to set correctly to get this to work. I am on Windows 11 and use Firefox also.

Thanks.

Jay M.
creator: jmartin.dfw

title: Gmail stops responding often
content: On a regular basis, gmail will stop responding in Thunderbird. It works once in a while but has trouble most of the time. It is as if it just won't connect or loses connection and then will not reconnect. I just see the "spinner" by the mouse and then it goes away and nothing happens. The inbox shows the emails from the last time that it was working properly but no new emails, and there is no way to send, receive, delete, etc. I have tried all sorts of things to resolve the issue (including removing the account completely and adding it back), and everything is set up as recommended, but eventually it just happens again and again. Can anyone help me to find a potential solution that will ultimately work?

title: Columns Settings Keep Resetting
content:
Currently running 102.8.0 on macOS 13.0, but I've had this issue [since upgrading from TB v68 to version 78.5.1] ever since upgrading from TB v68 to version 78.5.1 on macOS 10.14.6.

The short version is that my "From" column keeps disappearing. See here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0-NoRw6-ibU

This video shows how I right-click the column headers to enable the From column, and it appears correctly. But then I select any other mailbox, and when I return to the original mailbox, the From column disappears about 1/10th of a second later.

The long version is that it's the same for all my mail folders in all my accounts. No matter how I attempt to change which columns are visible and in what order, they always revert to the same old layout when I click to another mailbox and then return to the one I just edited.

Things I've tried that didn't improve anything:

  1. I started up in Safe mode, with all add-ons off.
  2. https://support.mozilla.org/nl/questions/1381677, disabled all add-ons, and reset toolbars and controls.
  3. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1386480?page=2 and allowed TB to re-create them
  4. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1386480?page=1 and allowed TB to re-create it.
  5. I bought a new computer and imported the old profile.

As with the other posters with this same problem, my back end is SmarterMail [Professional Build 8125 (Mar 31, 2022)], and that's not something that's under my control to change right now.
creator: steven64
